result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Louis Bidon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mark Louis Bidon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mark Louis Bidon was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Subject to good time and work release.
Must complete an AODA assessment and follow through.
Must report to Probation today (3/22/16). Must follow all rules of Probation and follow through. May petition for early discharge from Probation if agent deems appropriate.

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/cost to be paid to Clerk of Court Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will be warrant.

Must provide DNA sample and pay the $200.00 DNA surcharge to the Clerk of Court Office  Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process. 
For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms. within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will be warrant.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Louis Bidon

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

on Petition from Early Discharge from Probation - SIGNED 1/6/17
from DOC to Judge Anderson re early discharge recommendation

Defendant Mark Louis Bidon in court with attorney Chelsea Anne Whitley.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  BJM-clerk 10:37 am  Ct 1 amended to misd poss of THC - 961.41(3g)(e).  No amended info to be filed.

Ct 1 (as amended):  Def - G plea.  CT accepts plea, adj G & enters JOC.  
Ct 2 - Dismissed.

SENTENCT:  I/S 60 days PCJ, Subj GT & WR, 1 yr prob, Follow thru w/probation, No illegal drugs, AODA & follow thru, $200 DNA sample, $265.60 fine/costs, may petition for early discharge if appropriate, No jail credit, PCR.  Report to probation today.  10:49 am adj.
Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia unless valid prescription.

Defendant Mark Louis Bidon in court.  Stephen C. Dorrance appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JB-clerk 2:15pm  Atty Whitley not available for today. CT goes over cc/penalties. DEF-NG plea. CT-sets bond, sets hrg, WTL. adj 2:18pm  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 09:30 am.
